column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1 .
#Text=Introduction

#Text=The three-dimensional ( 3D ) surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy ( SERS ) substrate is a powerful analytical method with applications in the fields of medicine , environmental monitoring , and spectral imaging .
#Text=Compared to two-dimensional ( 2D ) SERS substrates , the 3D SERS substrate offers two unique advantages .

#Text=Specifically , because a 3D SERS substrate provides a larger surface area and a higher density of so-called “ hot spot ” zones along the vertical direction compared to a flat 2D substrate , the former allows increased sensitivity and greater enhancement .
#Text=The other advantage is that a 3D SERS substrate has a more wettable nanostructure , which will improve the SERS sensitivity and repeatability .
#Text=A 3D SERS substrate is typically composed of a combination of nanowires and metallic nanoparticles .
#Text=The metallic nanoparticles act as sensing units to generate hot spots in association with localized surface plasmon resonance , which greatly enhances the extent of Raman scattering .
#Text=The nanowires serve as the backbone of the 3D structure and the nanowire array also serves to further increase the repeatability of the Raman signal due to its periodic structure .
#Text=As an example , Oh et al. reported a 3D SERS substrate comprising a glass nanopillar array with silver nanoislands .
#Text=This substrate was found to have a high enhancement factor ( EF ) and increased the SERS signals by more than one order of magnitude compared to a 2D SERS substrate .

#Text=This improved performance was attributed to the ability of the silver nanoislands to generate a high density of hot spots on both the top and side of the glass nanopillar array . Park et al. used an Ar+ plasma to treat a polyethylene terephthalate surface to form polymeric nanopillars .

#Text=Gold nanoparticles were subsequently generated by evaporation to create a 3D gold-rich nanopillar structure that induced the self-clustering of plasmonic nanogaps due to capillary forces and increased the concentration of analyte on the substrate surface .
#Text=In 2018 , Wang et al. developed a 3D gold-rich nanopillar plasmonic substrate for use in SERS analyses that anchored mycotoxins via nanotags .

#Text=Their work determined that the surface tension induced a leaning effect in groups of two or three adjacent nanopillars that resulted in the self-assembly of hot spots , which , in turn , significantly enhanced the SERS signal .
#Text=Some SERS substrates , typically containing materials such as TiO2 and ZnO , can be reused following a self-cleaning process based on the photocatalytic degradation of residual analyte .

#Text=Following the SERS analysis , such substrates are exposed to either ultraviolet ( UV ) or visible ( VIS ) light to degrade residual analyte molecules , after which ions are removed using water wash .
#Text=Based on this procedure , the refreshed SERS substrate can be reused several times .
#Text=However , the structure and morphology of a metal layer deposited on a 3D structure are difficult to control , which results in a relatively low SERS enhancement .
#Text=In the present work , we developed a simple means of fabricating the 3D SERS substrates , based on coating silicon nanowire arrays with silver nanoparticles ( Ag-NP/Si-NW ) .
#Text=The morphology of these SERS substrates , which is critical to their performance , could be controlled using metal-assisted chemical etching ( MACE ) followed by photonic reduction .
#Text=Herein , we discuss the formation of silver nanoparticles via photonic reduction and their contribution to the SERS enhancement .
#Text=These 3D SERS substrates are also shown to be reusable after employing UV radiation to degrade dye molecules following an analysis .
#Text=Finally , these 3D SERS substrates were applied for the analysis of dopamine ( DA ) to verify that they provide both high sensitivity and reliability .
